availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Principal office located at Russellville, Kentucky. Chartered by the Commonwealth of Kentucky on February 20, 1839. Dissolved in 1865. President(s): George W. Norton. Cashier(s): M. B. Morton.
Branch office located at Carrollton, Kentucky. President(s): W. B. Winslow. Cashier(s): John A. Crawford.
Branch office located at Hickman, Kentucky. President(s): R. C. Prather. Cashier(s): Isaac Landes.

Branch office located at Louisville, Kentucky. President(s): A. A. Gordon, William B. Belknap. Cashier(s): Will Garnett, John G. Barret. Director(s): 1861—A. Rawson, John Ferguson, Jr., William Boswell, John Barret, and Warren Newcomb. 1864—G. H. Belknap, William Boswell, A. Rawson, John Long, and William B. Belknap.
Branch office located at Owensboro, Kentucky. President(s): S. M. Wing. Cashier(s): James B. Anderson.
Branch office located at Smithland, Kentucky. President(s): Thomas M. Davis. Cashier(s): Benjamin Barner.

ab.bibl:

Polk Johnson, 948.
J. Smith Homans, ed., The Bankers' Magazine, and Statistical Register, vol. XII (June 1860): 995. The Merchants' Bankers' Almanac for 1861 (New York: J. Smith Homans, Jr., Office of the Bankers' Magazine, 1861), 38. The Merchants' Bankers' Almanac for 1863 (New York: J. Smith Homans, Jr., Office of the Bankers' Magazine, 1863), 20. The Merchants' Bankers' Almanac for 1864 (New York: J. Smith Homans, Jr., Office of the Bankers' Magazine, 1864), 19. Campbell's Louisville Business Directory, for 1864 (Louisville, L. A. Civill, 1864), 91.
